User provide high-level research directi.Format: Natural language input specifying disease name or research target.
User provide high-level research directi.Example: The scientist directs the system by providing the name of the disease to target.
User provide high-level research directi.Role in workflow: Initiates the workflow and defines the scope for hypothesis generation and experimental planning.

User provide datasets other than researc.Format: Upload of raw or semi-processed experimental data (e.g., flow cytometry .fcs files, RNA-seq data).
User provide datasets other than researc.Example: The scientist uploads raw or semi-processed data and prompts Robin with a desired analysis approach.
User provide datasets other than researc.Role in workflow: Provides empirical results for autonomous analysis and hypothesis refinement.

Query Decomposition.Method details: LLM agents generate multiple focused queries from the disease name to cover diverse mechanistic and assay-related aspects.
Query Decomposition.Outputs: Lists of detailed literature search queries.
Query Decomposition.Example: Return a list of {num_queries} queries... to develop detailed, mechanistic cell culture assays...
Query Decomposition.Role in workflow: Enables comprehensive literature retrieval and structured exploration for hypothesis and assay generation.

Workflow Decomposition.Method details: Multi-agent system (Robin) orchestrates sequential subtasks: literature review, hypothesis generation, experimental planning, data analysis.
Workflow Decomposition.Outputs: Ordered workflow of subtasks assigned to specialized agents (Crow, Falcon, Finch).
Workflow Decomposition.Example: Robin utilizes specialized language agents for literature search (Crow and Falcon) and data analysis (Finch)...
Workflow Decomposition.Role in workflow: Breaks down the discovery process into manageable, agent-specific steps.

Pattern and Feature Extraction.Method details: Finch agent analyzes experimental data (e.g., flow cytometry, RNA-seq) to extract features such as gene expression changes or phagocytosis metrics.
Pattern and Feature Extraction.Outputs: Statistical summaries, plots, and identified significant features.
Pattern and Feature Extraction.Example: Finch executes analysis code in a Jupyter notebook and provides an interpretable and reproducible summary of its findings.
Pattern and Feature Extraction.Role in workflow: Transforms raw data into actionable insights for hypothesis refinement.

Data Retrieval via Multi-Query Generatio.Method details: LLM agents generate multiple literature search queries to cover broad mechanistic and assay-related topics.
Data Retrieval via Multi-Query Generatio.Outputs: Diverse sets of search queries for literature review.
Data Retrieval via Multi-Query Generatio.Example: Return a list of {num_queries} queries... to develop detailed, mechanistic cell culture assays...
Data Retrieval via Multi-Query Generatio.Role in workflow: Ensures comprehensive literature coverage for hypothesis and assay development.

Literature and Data Retrieval via APIs.Method details: PaperQA2-based agents (Crow, Falcon) access scientific literature, clinical trial reports, and Open Targets Platform.
Literature and Data Retrieval via APIs.Outputs: Relevant papers, clinical trial data, and platform-derived information.
Literature and Data Retrieval via APIs.Example: PaperQA2 achieves expert-level performance in information retrieval and summarization, with access to scientific literature, clinical trial reports, and the Open Targets Platform.
Literature and Data Retrieval via APIs.Role in workflow: Automates retrieval of relevant scientific evidence for downstream reasoning.

Data Retrieval with Prioritization and F.Method details: LLM judge ranks and filters literature-derived hypotheses and assay proposals via pairwise comparisons.
Data Retrieval with Prioritization and F.Outputs: Ranked lists of assays or therapeutic candidates.
Data Retrieval with Prioritization and F.Example: Robin uses an LLM judge to make pairwise comparisons between reports, which are used to calculate their relative rankings.
Data Retrieval with Prioritization and F.Role in workflow: Focuses attention on the most promising hypotheses and experimental strategies.

Domain-Specific Data Retrieval and Reaso.Method details: Agents query domain-specific resources (Open Targets Platform) and synthesize findings for hypothesis generation.
Domain-Specific Data Retrieval and Reaso.Example: PaperQA2... with access to scientific literature, clinical trial reports, and the Open Targets Platform.
Domain-Specific Data Retrieval and Reaso.Role in workflow: Ensures retrieval is tailored to biomedical context.

Literature data Retrieval via Multi-Step.Method details: Sequential evaluation of literature and candidate hypotheses using LLM-judged tournaments.
Literature data Retrieval via Multi-Step.Example: The drug candidates are ranked by an LLM-judged tournament according to the strength of the scientific rationale...
Literature data Retrieval via Multi-Step.Role in workflow: Refines candidate selection through iterative evidence-based evaluation.

Domain-Specific Literature data Retrieva.Method details: Agents use domain-specific keywords and context for targeted literature retrieval.
Domain-Specific Literature data Retrieva.Example: Crow and Falcon are used to conduct concise and deep literature searches, respectively, to gather information to guide hypothesis generation.
Domain-Specific Literature data Retrieva.Role in workflow: Targets literature most relevant to the disease and experimental context.

Data Retrieval via Domain-Specific Repos.Method details: Agents access Open Targets Platform and clinical trial reports for disease-relevant data.
Data Retrieval via Domain-Specific Repos.Example: PaperQA2... with access to scientific literature, clinical trial reports, and the Open Targets Platform.
Data Retrieval via Domain-Specific Repos.Role in workflow: Provides authoritative, up-to-date biomedical data for hypothesis generation.

Concise Synopsis and Summarization of Li.Method details: Crow agent produces concise literature reviews; Falcon generates deep, comprehensive summaries.
Concise Synopsis and Summarization of Li.Outputs: Summarized reports on disease mechanisms, assays, and candidate drugs.
Concise Synopsis and Summarization of Li.Example: Crow and Falcon are literature search agents... that conduct concise and deep literature summaries, respectively.
Concise Synopsis and Summarization of Li.Role in workflow: Condenses large volumes of literature into actionable insights for hypothesis generation.

Facet-Based or Field-Specific Extraction.Method details: Agents extract assay descriptions, mechanistic rationales, and candidate drug evaluations from literature.
Facet-Based or Field-Specific Extraction.Outputs: Structured reports detailing assay strategies and drug mechanisms.
Facet-Based or Field-Specific Extraction.Example: Crow prepares a detailed report describing an in vitro model of the disease mechanism and corresponding assay...
Facet-Based or Field-Specific Extraction.Role in workflow: Structures literature-derived knowledge for downstream evaluation and planning.

Domain-Tailored Extraction from Literatu.Method details: Extraction focuses on disease mechanisms, assay relevance, and drug mechanism-of-action.
Domain-Tailored Extraction from Literatu.Example: Falcon... generate a detailed report to evaluate each candidate. These reports contain both justification... and potential limitations...
Domain-Tailored Extraction from Literatu.Role in workflow: Ensures extracted knowledge is relevant to biomedical discovery.

LLM Agent Generate ideas/hypotheses via.Method details: Robin orchestrates sequential subtasks (mechanism identification, assay proposal, candidate generation) assigned to specialized agents.
LLM Agent Generate ideas/hypotheses via.Outputs: Lists of disease mechanisms, assays, and candidate drugs.
LLM Agent Generate ideas/hypotheses via.Example: Robin formulates a series of general questions about the disease pathology and queries Crow to answer each question...
LLM Agent Generate ideas/hypotheses via.Role in workflow: Enables systematic exploration of the hypothesis space.

Generate ideas/hypotheses using Domain-S.Method details: Crow, Falcon, and Finch are specialized for literature review and data analysis in biomedical contexts.
Generate ideas/hypotheses using Domain-S.Outputs: Mechanistic hypotheses, assay proposals, drug candidates.
Generate ideas/hypotheses using Domain-S.Example: Robin utilizes specialized language agents for literature search (Crow and Falcon) and data analysis (Finch)...
Generate ideas/hypotheses using Domain-S.Role in workflow: Leverages domain expertise for hypothesis generation.

Literature data used during idea/hypothe.Method details: Hypotheses are generated using literature reviews as context for LLM-based reasoning.
Literature data used during idea/hypothe.Example: Robin uses the reports from Crow as context... to generate hypotheses.
Literature data used during idea/hypothe.Role in workflow: Grounds hypothesis generation in current scientific knowledge.

Summarization Literature data used durin.Method details: Summarized literature sections are provided as input to candidate generation prompts.
Summarization Literature data used durin.Example: Robin synthesizes this strategy into an overall goal and then generates several novel therapeutic candidates...
Summarization Literature data used durin.Role in workflow: Ensures hypotheses are informed by key findings from literature.

Idea/hypothesis generation via Pattern D.Method details: Finch analyzes experimental data (e.g., RNA-seq) to identify differentially expressed genes and pathways.
Idea/hypothesis generation via Pattern D.Outputs: Identified patterns (e.g., upregulation of ABCA1) used for mechanistic insight.
Idea/hypothesis generation via Pattern D.Example: Finch’s DGE analysis revealed that Y-27632 treatment also induced rapid transcriptional changes...
Idea/hypothesis generation via Pattern D.Role in workflow: Links empirical data patterns to mechanistic hypotheses.

LLM-based Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via.Method details: LLM judge (Claude 3.7 Sonnet) evaluates hypotheses for scientific rationale, novelty, and plausibility via pairwise comparisons.
LLM-based Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via.Example: The ranking of hypotheses was calculated via a series of pairwise comparisons adjudicated by the LLM judge.
LLM-based Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via.Role in workflow: Selects the most promising hypotheses for experimental testing.

LLM-based Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via.Method details: LLM judge uses domain-specific criteria (pharmacological profile, methodology, literature support) for ranking.
LLM-based Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via.Outputs: Ranked lists of assays and drug candidates.
LLM-based Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via.Example: The drug candidates are ranked by an LLM-judged tournament according to the strength of the scientific rationale, pharmacological profile, and methodology...
LLM-based Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via.Role in workflow: Ensures prioritization aligns with biomedical standards.

LLM-based Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via.Method details: LLM judge integrates evidence from literature and experimental data to inform ranking.
LLM-based Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via.Example: LLM judge demonstrated high concordance with expert preferences...
LLM-based Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via.Role in workflow: Ranks candidates based on contextual evidence.

Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via Novelty C.Method details: LLM judge considers whether candidates have been previously proposed for the disease.
Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via Novelty C.Outputs: Novelty assessment as part of ranking.
Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via Novelty C.Example: Ripasudil is a clinically-used rho kinase (ROCK) inhibitor that has never previously been proposed for treating dAMD.

Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via Human/Exp.Method details: Human experts compare and validate LLM judge rankings; expert evaluations used to tune LLM judge prompts.
Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via Human/Exp.Example: When comparing the LLM judge’s preferences with experts’, the LLM judge demonstrated high concordance with expert preferences...
Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via Human/Exp.Role in workflow: Ensures LLM-based prioritization aligns with human expertise.

Experimental Design Generation via liter.Method details: Robin selects experimental assays based on literature review of disease mechanisms and prior models.
Experimental Design Generation via liter.Example: Robin... deploys Crow to prepare a detailed report describing an in vitro model of the disease mechanism and corresponding assay...
Experimental Design Generation via liter.Role in workflow: Ensures experimental design is grounded in validated models.

Experimental Design Generation via Liter.Method details: Robin synthesizes literature findings to propose experimental strategies and assay goals.
Experimental Design Generation via Liter.Example: Robin synthesizes this strategy into an overall goal and then generates several novel therapeutic candidates...
Experimental Design Generation via Liter.Role in workflow: Integrates literature to create actionable experimental plans.

LLM-Based Experimental Design Generation.Method details: Robin coordinates agents to iteratively plan and refine experimental strategies based on literature and data.
LLM-Based Experimental Design Generation.Example: Robin drives an iterative therapeutics development cycle where hypotheses are generated, tested, analyzed, and refined...

LLM-Based Experimental Design Generation.Method details: Crow, Falcon, and Finch collaborate to generate, analyze, and refine experimental designs.
LLM-Based Experimental Design Generation.Example: Robin utilizes specialized language agents for literature search (Crow and Falcon) and data analysis (Finch)...
LLM-Based Experimental Design Generation.Role in workflow: Leverages agent specialization for robust experimental planning.

Test Execution via Human-in-the-Loop.Method details: Human researchers execute experimental protocols suggested by Robin and upload resulting data for analysis.
Test Execution via Human-in-the-Loop.Example: Researchers next conduct the experiments and provide the resulting data to Robin for autonomous analysis.
Test Execution via Human-in-the-Loop.Role in workflow: Bridges automated planning with real-world experimentation.

Refinement via LLM Agent Feedback Loops.Method details: Robin iteratively updates hypotheses and experimental plans based on analysis of new experimental data.
Refinement via LLM Agent Feedback Loops.Example: Robin distills actionable scientific insights from these processed experimental results... used to inform the next cycle of therapeutic hypothesis generation.
Refinement via LLM Agent Feedback Loops.Role in workflow: Enables continuous improvement of hypotheses and strategies.

Refinement via Dynamic Agent Updating Ba.Method details: Robin and Finch update hypotheses and analyses in response to new experimental findings.
Refinement via Dynamic Agent Updating Ba.Example: Robin can launch 10 Finch analysis trajectories... a meta-analysis can be conducted to synthesize all outputs into a consensus-driven conclusion.
Refinement via Dynamic Agent Updating Ba.Role in workflow: Adapts reasoning and planning to evolving empirical context.

Refinement via guided by computational-d.Method details: Finch performs statistical analyses (e.g., Dunnett test, DGE analysis) to guide hypothesis refinement.
Refinement via guided by computational-d.Outputs: Statistical test results, updated candidate rankings.
Refinement via guided by computational-d.Example: Finch performs statistical tests to compare candidate drugs to the DMSO control and plots the results.
Refinement via guided by computational-d.Role in workflow: Ensures refinement is data-driven and statistically grounded.

Refinement via experimental validation.Method details: Hypotheses and candidate drugs are experimentally tested; outcomes inform subsequent hypothesis cycles.
Refinement via experimental validation.Example: The cycle continues until a human has a satisfactory novel drug candidate.
Refinement via experimental validation.Role in workflow: Closes the loop between hypothesis and empirical validation.

Refinement via Human–data integration.Method details: Humans upload experimental data and can review/refine candidate lists based on Robin’s outputs.
Refinement via Human–data integration.Example: This ranked list can then be reviewed by human scientists, and top drug candidates can be tested in the lab...
Refinement via Human–data integration.Role in workflow: Combines human judgment with automated analysis for robust discovery.

paper_title: Robin: A multi-agent system for automating scientific discovery
